availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob Keller (Jefferson County, Kentucky, grocer and merchant)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, grocer and merchant. Maryland native. Married to Honora Carpenter Keller in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on April 21, 1830. Father of Catharine B. Keller Thruston, Leonora Keller, and Ione B. Keller Page. Grocer in Louisville in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Merchant in Louisville in 1860. Employed Mary Kennedy as a domestic in Louisville in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.
